title: Digital Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sheppard Pratt Health System (Towson, MD) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Even though I didn't get the job I was applying for, interviewing with Sheppard Pratt was one of the best interview-experiences I've ever had. I had an HR screening call, a phone interview with two members of the marketing department, an in-person meeting with the same people, and an in-person interview with the rest of their marketing team. Every step of the way I was treated with total respect. People were kind, well-prepared, and listened when I was answering which helped to create a real dialogue and give me a strong sense of what being a part of their team would look like. What I found most interesting was that they started in-person interviews by asking if I had any questions for them since we'd talked last. It showed a real sense of partnership and balance of power between interviewer and interviewee. While I'm sad to have not been picked, I'd absolutely recommend trying to work here.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sheppard Pratt Health System

title: Case Manager Interview

title: Mental Health Worker Interview

title: Mental Health Worker Interview

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheppard Pratt Health System in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Management and HR lack professional skills. After submitting my application I received a call back within a day or two. I interviewed in 2017 for a staff position. I completed share time to experience the floor. After providing a follow up email to HR and the unit manager, the process ran cold. No response. Have enough respect for your candidates to follow through on the process. Whichever way it goes, I just wanted closure. During the hiring process, candidates gather information and form thoughts about the organization as well. The manager was young and seemed to lack confidence as a manager. Her response about her managerial style had a negative undertone,  she seemed defensive and lacked insight about her management skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Sheppard Pratt?
